messageBody:
As an FYI - one open source project (SOAj) provides (in a base class)
two representative convenience methods for asserting exceptions. In
addition to a specific exception class being asserted, the
originating class and method throwing the exception (that is, the
exception context) may be asserted.


public abstract class SjBaseOutsideContainerTestCase extends TestCase
{

/**
* Assert that a throwable was thrown from the expected class
and method.
*
* @param expectedClassContext
* @param expectedMethodContext
* @param throwable
*
* @return boolean
*/
protected static boolean assertThrowableContext(
final Class<?> expectedClassContext,
final String expectedMethodContext,
final SjInterfaceThrowable throwable) {

// Declare/Initialize
final SjPopulatedMethodName methodName = new SjPopulatedMethodName(
expectedMethodContext, null);

// Check for equality.
if (expectedClassContext.getName().equalsIgnoreCase(
throwable.getThrowableAttributes().getClassname())
&& methodName.getString().equalsIgnoreCase(

throwable.getThrowableAttributes().getMethodname())) {

// Early return.
return true;
}

fail("The throwable [" + throwable.getClass().getName()
+ "] not thrown from expected class ["
+ expectedClassContext.getName() + "] and/or expected method
["
+ expectedMethodContext + "].\n"
+ "However, it was thrown from class ["
+ throwable.getThrowableAttributes().getClassname()
+ "] and method ["
+ throwable.getThrowableAttributes().getMethodname() + "].");

return false;
}

/**
* Assert that a specified throwable was thrown.
*
* @param expectedThrowableClass
* @param actualThrowable
*
* @return boolean
*/
protected static boolean assertThrowable(
final Class<?> expectedThrowableClass,
final Throwable actualThrowable) {

if (expectedThrowableClass.getName().equalsIgnoreCase(
actualThrowable.getClass().getName())) {

return true;
}

fail("Expected throwable [" + expectedThrowableClass.getName()
+ "] not thrown.\n" + "However, an unexpected ["
+ actualThrowable.getClass().getName()
+ "] exception was thrown.");

return false;
}
